answers.answer: liver tests can be slightly elevated for a multitude of reasons, the majority of which are nothing to worry about including some naturally occurring enzyme disorders that affect the normal population. one set of abnormal blood tests mean s nothing so let's wait to see what the repeat profile shows.  this is extremely common.

question: I took my 9 yr old son for a diabetes just because it runs in our family , the doctor gave me the results today she said everything else was normal but she said he had a slighty elevated liver functional enzymes, and he has to go back for a follow-up next week for more blood work, I am so worried could this be serious? And what exactly does having a slightly elevated liver functional enzymes mean ? Im so worried for my little boy its driving me crazy
title: slightly elevated liver functional enzymes
